data.name: Prop_DateFormat
data.value: Optionally specify the format for date values sent. If blank, the default value 'yyyy-MM-dd' will be used. Never include time specifiers such as 'hh:mm:ss'. This setting only affects the ordering of the date parts; always use dashes (-) as delimiters — the delimiter that will be effectively used is controlled by the above locale setting (or that of your site).

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_Anim
data.value: When filters are applied or cleared, FilterZen by default shows a SharePoint-typical animation (the green spinner) to indicate that an operation is in progress. If desired for design customization or branding purposes, you can enter an alternative picture URL to use for this animation. This can be an absolute or a server-relative URL such as /_layouts/images/roxority_FilterZen/k.gif for example.

data.name: CamlOp_Member
data.value: is member of Site Collection user group

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_Auto1Begins
data.value: When connected to List View Web Parts, Text Filters can be set up to offer end users a "List-based AutoSuggest drop-down, if possible", providing find-as-you-type suggestions for assisted input completion. This drop-down (always limited to the maximum number of entries configured below) invokes an AJAX search against the connected List for the Column targeted by the Text Filter, and returns values containing the current text box input. For huge datasets, it might be more desirable to only match values that start with (rather than contain) the currently typed in letter as long as only a single one has been typed, so that entering B shows all values starting with B. The drawback to this might be end user confusion because the AutoSuggest drop-down will revert to "contains" logic as soon as more letters are typed. (Note: when the Text Filter has its own filter operator set to Begins with, the AutoSuggest will always use begins-with instead of contains logic.) Tick this check box to use begins-with rather than contains for single-letter inputs.

data.name: Groups
data.value: Filter Groups

data.name: RespectFilters
data.value: ...but always merge their URL-supplied filter values together with your Zen filters into the dynamically generated overall view query (recommended)

data.name: ItemSort_5
data.value: by value column, ascending (A..Z)

data.name: ItemSort_4
data.value: by display frequency, descending (n..1)

data.name: ItemSort_7
data.value: by value frequency, ascending (1..n)

data.name: ItemSort_6
data.value: by value column, descending (Z..A)

data.name: ItemSort_1
data.value: by display column, ascending (A..Z)

data.name: ItemSort_0
data.value: as specified by List View or CAML

data.name: ItemSort_3
data.value: by display frequency, ascending (1..n)

data.name: ItemSort_2

data.name: ItemSort_8
data.value: by value frequency, descending (n..1)

data.name: ShowClearButtons
data.value: Also show a Reset icon next to each interactive filter *

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_Datasheet
data.value:
Datasheet Views don't support Web Part Connections and instead of simply ignoring these, unfortunately they usually just fail to display. As a result, when a user clicks 'Edit in Datasheet' in your FilterZen-connected List View, an error message is displayed in place of the data. You can resolve this by either ticking the On pages with nothing but a single List View, automatically filter it connectionless check-box option in the Advanced Filtering Settings section of the FilterZen Web Part's settings tool-pane (SharePoint 2010 only) — or alternatively, if you manually add a new, separate, dedicated (public) Datasheet View to the List, then FilterZen can automatically redirect your users to this separate Datasheet View page when they select 'Edit in Datasheet' in any View.

Select the 'Auto-redirect' choice to allow this kind of redirection of users to your dedicated Datasheet View when they click 'Edit in Datasheet' on a non-Datasheet View. If you select 'Ignore', then 'Edit in Datasheet' on a connected List View page may result in the error message: "There is no valid configuration for these connected parts to run in." (Note: SharePoint 2010 also lets you disable datasheet views on a per-List basis via List Settings / Advanced Settings.)

data.name: FilterType_PageField
data.value: Page Column Filter

data.name: MultiFilterHint
data.value:
Some of your filters are sending multiple values.
In most cases this usually only works with the "CAML Direct filtering mode" enabled and specific connection types IF you're targeting a List View, Data Form, BCS/BDC List / Related List or XSL / Data View or PeopleZen Web Part. (Click edit → Modify Web Part and make sure the CAML Direct filtering mode is enabled under Filtering Mode.) If you're connected to other types of Web Parts, the CAML Direct filtering mode will probably be ignored by the target Web Part and support for multiple filter values depends entirely on the developers of the target Web Part.

data.name: JqueryWarning
data.value: Your interactive multi-selection filters could not be initialized properly, presumably because the jQuery library has been included in this page both by FilterZen and some external Web Part or by your current page design. You can try fixing this under the 'Advanced Filtering Settings' for this Web Part: select 'No, never' under 'Include jQuery library'. If your Filter Web Part does not break and your multi-selection filters now display properly after leaving Edit Mode, then this resolved the issue — if not, please revert these changes.

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_ExcludeViews
data.value:
The "List View Picker" filter type lets end users select a different List View to apply to the connected List View Web Part. View pages whose URL paths contain any one of the values specified here (one per line) will NOT be offered for end user selection by this filter type.

combine.aspx refers to the built-in Merge Documents view, repair.aspx to the built-in Relink Documents view, webfldr.aspx to the 2007 Explorer view. These are generally not desirable in a List View Picker context.

data.name: _HomeHelpTopics

data.name: FilterDesc_ZenLookup
data.value: Look up the filter value, or let users pick one, from a SharePoint List, Gallery or Document Library, an SQL or ADO.NET data source, a user profile or the Business Data Catalog (BCS/BDC).

data.name: Datasheet
data.value: Datasheet views don't support Web Part Connections and instead of simply ignoring these, unfortunately they usually just fail to display. You can resolve this by ticking the On pages with nothing but a single List View, automatically filter it connectionless check-box option in the Advanced Filtering Settings section of this FilterZen Web Part's settings tool-pane (SharePoint 2010 only) — or alternatively, if you add a new, separate, dedicated (public) Datasheet View to this List and select the appropriate How to deal with 'Edit in Datasheet' configuration option, then FilterZen will automatically redirect your users to this separate Datasheet View page when they select 'Edit in Datasheet'.

data.name: Prop_PostFilterFieldName
data.value: Specify the internal name (you can find it out with this tool) of the Column to test for existence of pickable filter values. (Leave blank to use the Title Column.)

data.name: SendCellTo
data.value: Send Single Data Value To

data.name: CfgSettingTitle_PickerLimit
data.value: Hard limit for pickable choices in drop-down filters

data.name: Prop_CatchAll
data.value: Advanced: treat the 'Column / filter name' of this filter (specified at the top) as the name of a bundling parameter, and catch-all (and send) the column names and filter values specified by all its sub-parameters dynamically. (Use '?' to catch-all request parameters without sub-parameter handling.)

data.name: ValidNames
data.value:
Based on the currently available connection information, you can safely use these known filter names.
  • {0}
  • (However, most Web Parts do not report all the column / filter names that can be effectively used. To find out additional names that work with the currently connected Web Parts, experiment with internal column names of Lists used by the currently connected Web Parts, or consult the developer or documentation of the currently connected Web Parts.)
  • If the above filter names start with '@' and don't work, try them without the prefix (column names are sometimes reported that way by XSL / Data View Web Parts).

data.name: Highlight
data.value: Emulate Search behavior by: highlighting partial matches in connected consumer List Views *

data.name: Ajax14Interval
data.value: to emulate Asynchronous Automatic Refresh, auto-invoke their Manual Refresh buttons every

data.name: SelectedGroupConn
data.value: — if the Order of connection events below indicates that Sent events occurred before any Received events, try to recreate all your connections in the desired order, or choose a different provider Web part from the edit → Connections → Get Current Filter Group From menu for this Filter Web Part. The current filter group must have been received before the first values are being sent.

data.name: CfgSettingCaption_AllowCells
data.value: 'Data Cell' Connection Type

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_AutoLimit
data.value: In an AutoSuggest drop-down, when more than say 20-30 items are displayed, users are much more likely to further refine their text input rather than scan hundreds of choices, and a low limit drastically improves performance of List-based auto-completion drop-downs in Text filters. To customize this, enter an integer number higher than 1, otherwise the default value of 40 will be used as the limit.

data.name: RowLabel
data.value:
Limited Filter Web Part and Filter editability due to active 'Send Values As Data Row' Connection.
This Filter Web Part currently sends one or more filter values as a data row to connected Web Parts. You can mostly edit this Web Part and its Filters freely, but before you can disable, rename or remove Filters, you first need to: close the Web Part tool pane, temporarily remove the 'Send Values As Data Row' Connections set up for this Web Part, and re-create them after you have saved your Web Part and Filter modifications.

data.value: [REQUIRES SharePoint Server and BCS/BDC] Obtains a Business Data Connectivity (BCS/BDC) external data record / entity instance ID from a connected provider Web Part (instead of the 'ID' URL parameter), and sends the BCS/BDC entity instance to all connected BCS/BDC Web Parts (and any other type of consumer).

data.value: Pre-filtering — only offer pickable choices that also exist in a List column:

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_RememberStorage
data.value: FilterZen Web Parts can be set to 'Remember filter values last used for each user'. By default these values are stored both in the user agent (browser) and in the SharePoint content database, but this configuration settings lets you override that default hybrid storage model. Client-side cookies may be cleared by users or blocked due to corporate security policies. Server-side storage may in rare configurations fail silently due to administrative access restrictions even for elevated code, or with large user bases may inflate the content database over time.

data.value: Matching URL format example:

data.name: SectionDesc_Interactive
data.value:
This Web Part currently contains enabled 'interactive' filters. These filters render a visible user interface control into the Web Part Page to allow end-user filtering, because you have set them to 'Allow users to enter / pick a filter value'. You can customize the behaviour and appearance of this visible and interactive Web Part area:

(* options marked with * are not available for Dynamic Ad-Hoc Filters)

data.name: _SettingGroups
data.value: Ux:PickerLimit|Filters:Auto1Begins|Advanced:RememberByNameOnly

data.name: FilterDesc_Multi
data.value: Lets end users arrange their own filters (fields, values and operators) interactively, directly inside the Web Part (instead of imposing a static arrangement of pre-defined filters). The name for this filter does not directly matter since users add their own filters on the fly, but DO give it a valid field, column or filter name (such as Title) as usual!

data.name: CfgSettingChoice_Datasheet_none
data.value: Ignore problem (displays Microsoft error message)

data.value: range: > x and <= y

data.name: CamlOp_RangeGtLt
data.value: range: > x and < y

data.name: CamlOp_RangeGeLt
data.value: range: >= x and < y

data.name: CamlOp_RangeGeLe
data.value: range: >= x and <= y

data.name: CfgSettingDesc_RememberByNameOnly
data.value: FilterZen Web Parts can be set to 'Remember filter values last used for each user'. By default these stored values are unique to the user, the filter name and the FilterZen Web Part storing them. Tick this check box to store and restore values only based on the user and filter name instead, which lets you share filter values of the same name between multiple individual FilterZen Web Parts.

data.name: JqueryNone
data.value:
jQuery is not being embedded — more...
You have decided to not have this FilterZen Filter Web Part load the jQuery library into this page. This will break the Filter Web Part unless jQuery v1.4.4 or higher is being included by some other Web Part or by your page design. If FilterZen stopped working after you changed your page design or removed some other Web Part, re-include jQuery from the Web Part settings or via the Product Configuration.

data.name: Prop_RelativeOffsetForDefaultOnly
data.value: Only do this when the filter value was initialized from the specified default date filter value, and never for a user-selected current filter value

data.name: ReasonNull
data.value: This filter did not return any filter pairs.

data.name: Prop_NumberCulture
data.value: Optionally specify the locale for numeric values when using the above format string: either the locale's short name (eg. en-us) or its numeric locale ID (eg. 1033). See product documentation for a complete list of valid settings.

data.name: SearchBehavior
data.value: Emulate Search behavior by: showing no results in the consumer Web Part until filters are explicitly applied by the user (do not use Remember filter values with this option)

data.name: CfgSettingCaption_Auto1Begins
data.value: In Text filters' List-based AutoSuggest drop-downs, 1-character entries use BeginsWith instead of Contains

data.name: AutoNoField
data.value: Unknown column: {0}

data.name: GetValuesFrom
data.value: Get Filter Values from

data.name: GroupsDesc
data.value:
You can create multiple filter groups (more...) below (one per line).
As soon and as long as you have more than one filter group defined, you can select for each of your filters all the groups it belongs to and only filters belonging to the 'currently selected filter group' will ever be used. By default, the first group will be initially selected. To switch between groups, create an additional Web Part (any kind) on this Web Part page that sends via a Web Part Connection the currently selected filter group to this Filter Web Part.

data.name: Prop_RepostOnChange
data.value: Immediate automatic re-filtering upon user input *

data.name: Section_Filters
data.value: All Filters

data.name: ResultFirst
data.value: (The first row in the result set)

data.name: FilterDesc_SqlData
data.value: Specify an ADO.NET or SQL data source query to obtain a filter value automatically or to let users pick one.

data.name: ReasonNonActive
data.value: Filter was set to suppress its value(s) UNLESS end user has interactively applied this Filter Web Part.

data.name: MultiLabel
data.value:
Limited Filter Web Part and '{0}' Filter editability due to active 'Send Transformable Values' Connection.
This Filter Web Part currently sends transformable '{0}' filter values to connected Web Parts. You can mostly edit this Web Part and its Filters freely, but before you can disable, rename or remove the '{0}' Filter or change the 'Send Transformable Values' Connection to another Filter from this Filter Web Part, you first need to: close the Web Part tool pane, temporarily remove the 'Send Transformable Values' Connection, and re-create it after you have saved your Web Part and Filter modifications.

data.name: MultiCount
data.value: This Filter Web Part contains more than one enabled '{0}'. This is not supported and may lead to unexpected results. Remove the other filters of this type.

data.name: Prop_AdoDataProvider
data.value: Specify the ADO.NET data source provider used by this filter to connect to the data source. (Data source providers can be configured in the FilterZen Studio.)

data.name: HelpTopic_list_lookup_filters
data.value: List Lookup Filters

data.name: Prop_DisplayColumnName
data.value: Optionally specify the display column — the name of the column displaying the filter value. (Leave blank to use the above value column.)

data.name: Prop_BdcValueField
data.value: Specify the value field — the Business Data field providing the filter value:

data.value: ...combine different filter names with OR (instead of AND) by default

data.name: CamlDistinct
data.value: This filter requires the CAML Direct filtering mode to be enabled and may degrade performance for large Lists (a few hundred records or more).
